trans-unit.source: Represents the exception that occurs during validation of a data field when the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute"></xref> class is used.
A validation exception occurs if an input value does not match the expected data type, range or pattern of the data field.
For example, if a user enters an integer value in a data field that expects a <xref:System.Data.SqlDbType.DateTime> value, a validation exception occurs.
This class uses the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute> class to customize validations.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationException> is thrown if a validation error occurs.
The exception is thrown when the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.Validate%2A> method is called.
All the exceptions that are thrown during validation are contained in the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.IDynamicValidatorException.InnerExceptions%2A> collection.
You can retrieve each validation exception by iterating through the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.IDynamicValidatorException.InnerExceptions%2A> collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationException"></xref> class using an error message generated by the system.
This method is the default constructor for the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationException> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationException"></xref> class using a specified error message.
For more information about how to use this constructor, see [How to: Customize Data Field Validation in the Data Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/47d3b04e-1ab5-466d-bc58-92f163f3d7f5).
A specified message that states the error.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationException"></xref> class using serialized data.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object that is transmitted over a stream.
The object that holds the serialized data.
Context information about the source or destination of the serialized object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationException"></xref> class using a specified error message and a collection of inner exception instances.
You typically will not use this constructor because validation exceptions are stored in the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.IDynamicValidatorException.InnerExceptions%2A> property, not `innerException`.
The error message.
The collection of validation exceptions.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationException"></xref> class by using a validation result, a validation attribute, and the value of the current exception.
The list of validation results.
The attribute that caused the current exception.
The value of the object that caused the attribute to trigger the validation error.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationException"></xref> class using a specified error message, a validation attribute, and the value of the current exception.
For more information, see How to: Customize Data Field Validation in the Data Model.
The message that states the error.
The attribute that caused the current exception.
The value of the object that caused the attribute to trigger validation error.
Gets the instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute"></xref> class that triggered this exception.
This type is used to enforce validation based on the metadata associated with the data table.
If an error occurs, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute> class triggers a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationException>.
This class can be overridden to create custom validation attributes.
An instance of the validation attribute type that triggered this exception.
Gets the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationException.ValidationResult"></xref> instance that describes the validation error.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationException.ValidationResult"></xref> instance that describes the validation error.
Gets the value of the object that causes the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute"></xref> class to trigger this exception.
The value of the object that caused the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute"></xref> class to trigger the validation error.
